revised_title: The Influence of Acids, Alkalis, and Carbon Dioxide on Electrotonic Currents in Medullated Nerve
tldr: This study investigates the effects of acids, alkalis, and carbon dioxide on electrotonic currents in medullated nerve. The results show that acids and alkalis alter the anodic and cathodic currents, while carbon dioxide primarily causes an augmentation of the cathodic current and a diminution of the anodic current. These findings contribute to our understanding of nerve physiology and electrolytic polarization.
